Key Match Events: Brenton Doyle made a diving catch in the second inning to rob a potential extra-base hit.
Brenton Doyle exited the game in the fifth inning due to a left hand injury after the catch.
The Rockies lost the game 5-2 to the Brewers.
Post-Match Reflections: Rockies manager Bud Black praised Doyle's defensive plays and his ability to shine in high-pressure moments.
Bud Black highlighted Doyle's throw the previous night as a significant defensive achievement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockies fell behind early with back-to-back home runs in the first inning.
Ryan McMahon hit a lead-off homer in the fourth inning.
Jaden Hill made his Major League debut, pitching a scoreless inning.
